What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine? Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond. The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The opportunity: your next adventure awaits _________ Purpose matters. It’s the core of who we are as an organization. The way we bring purpose to life for our people, clients and communities sets us apart, and defines the legacy we’ll leave. At EY, we don’t just believe businesses can and should do more to foster inclusive growth. We come to work every day and make it so. Our bold social impact ambition of “Building a better working world” is more than a rallying cry. It’s a way of being. What does that mean? We’re proactively building and executing programs and relationships that enable our people to support the next generation, work with high-impact entrepreneurs, and advance environmental sustainability. We’re fueling that mission by partnering with like-minded organizations on the right initiatives. And we’re inspiring people across EY Singapore to play an active role in EY Ripples – a Global volunteer program that seeks to impact 1 billion lives by 2030. When we work together to bring purpose to life, we can drive real change, advance communities, and address society’s toughest challenges. Getting there requires a proactive, business-savvy marketing executive who can help develop and manage firmwide initiatives and engage EY people along the way.  If you’re as passionate and optimistic about the power of purpose as we are, you may just be our next Corporate Responsibility intern. We’re looking for a relationship developer, negotiator and project manager. As part of the Brand team, you’ll work closely with EY Singapore’s Corporate Responsibility team to build an effective, integrated plan to support our purpose-led initiatives, and connect them to firm priorities and other programs. This is a unique opportunity to help a best-in-class employer reinvent and elevate our impact strategy and unlock new ways to engage our people that moves them to action. Your key responsibilities Design and activate internal employee awareness and engagement initiatives that align with initiatives and purpose-driven activations Judiciously work within the corporate responsibility budget, ensuring proper tracking and spending Measure and report KPIs regularly Co-develop programs, events or activities with third party collaborators (Non-profit organizations, Social enterprises, etc.) Act as a main point of contact between EY and third-party collaborators Recruit EY volunteers that are suitable for the event / activity Provide briefing to employees prior to volunteering to ensure they understand their responsibilities and the do’s and don’ts Coordinate logistics with staff on the day of volunteering to ensure that the event / activity goes smoothly Be present at all activities and events to co-facilitate with relevant parties Conduct check-ins with staff and volunteers during and after the event or activity to ensure smooth collaboration. Collect feedback from EY people on their experience with third party collaborators Provide feedback to third party collaborators on the EY people’s experience. Discuss with third party collaborators on potential areas of improvement for the next collaboration. Skills and attributes Ability to develop strategic, proactive relationships with third party collaborators Track record of identifying emerging trends in corporate social responsibility and bringing new ideas to the table At ease managing multiple projects in a deadline-driven, fast-paced and matrixed environment Compelling public speaker and effective individual communicator who articulates concepts and ideas clearly Strong strategic, organizational, and autonomous project management skills Excellent analytical skills to assess, iterate and report on KPIs and results Superb networking, teaming and negotiating skills Process-driven, always looking for ways to improve efficiency and effectiveness Committed to the principle that diverse perspectives – combined with an inclusive culture – drive better decisions, stimulate innovation, improve organizational agility and strengthen resilience to disruption __________ Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. To learn more about careers in EY, please visit Careers at EY or connect with us on social media (Facebook or Instagram) to hear from our people about their EY careers. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

We turn customer challenges into growth opportunities. Material is a global strategy partner to the world’s most recognizable brands and innovative companies. Our people around the globe thrive by helping organizations design and deliver rewarding customer experiences. We use deep human insights, design innovation and data to create experiences powered by modern technology. Our approaches speed engagement and growth for the companies we work with and transform relationships between businesses and the people they serve. Srijan, a Material company, is a renowned global digital engineering firm with a reputation for solving complex technology problems using their deep technology expertise and leveraging strategic partnerships with top-tier technology partners. The Role Job Summary We are seeking a dynamic Lead Data Scientist to lead our data science and engineering initiatives within the media domain. This pivotal role requires an experienced professional capable of navigating the intricacies of the end-to-end data science and modeling lifecycle, having a strong problem-solving ability and a knack for statistical analysis along with a strong emphasis on Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) practices. If you’re also able to align our data products with our business goals, we’d like to meet you. Position Overview As the Lead Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leading a team of data scientists and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive the end-to-end data science and modeling lifecycle, emphasizing MLOps principles. Your primary focus will be on researching, developing, and implementing AI solutions, particularly in the extraction of metadata from diverse media content, including audio, video, image, and text. You will be instrumental in shaping and executing the data science strategy, ensuring the successful deployment and orchestration of models in collaboration with Operations teams. Responsibilities:- Demonstrated expertise with 6-10 years of hands-on experience in AI/ML, NLP, Python, and cloud platforms such as AWS/Azure/GCP. Proven proficiency in advanced technologies including Computer Vision, Machine Vision, Speech Recognition, and Docker. Lead the ideation, research, and development of sophisticated machine learning models for media content analysis, employing cutting-edge techniques such as natural language processing, computer vision, speech recognition, and deep learning. Incorporate MLOps principles to ensure scalability, repeatability, and automation in the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle. Exhibit agility by rapidly prototyping solutions and building models to assess the feasibility of various solution approaches. Develop robust, scalable, and production-grade data pipelines and machine learning models to address key business problems, regardless of the volume or diversity of data sets. Construct scalable AI/ML solutions, tailored to specific requirements, spanning NLP, Computer/Machine Vision, Speech Recognition, Clustering, Segmentation, and Deep Learning. Optimize models for performance, taking into consideration real-world constraints and requirements. Write reusable code following best software engineering practices, accommodating common design patterns and Object-Oriented Programming (OOPs) principles. Establish and enforce coding standards, documentation practices, and model version control within the team. Spearhead discussions with Operations teams, ensuring the smooth deployment, optimization, and orchestration of machine learning models. Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and content creation, to gather requirements and deliver impactful, technically sound solutions. Ideal Profile Must Have Skills 6+ years of relevant data science experience in a delivery focused team Strong coding ability in Python, familiarity with relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and general software development skills (source code management, debugging, testing, deployment, etc.) is a must Knowledge of both traditional as well awareness with existing state of the art methods in Machine Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Speech Recognition, Transfer Learning, Text Analysis, Information Extraction and Retrieval with a proven track record of applying them to real problems. Experience with end-to-end model deployment and orchestration in production environments. Experience in cloud computing like AWS is a plus Experience in microservice based architectures with model containerization using Docker is a must (Kubernetes experience will be an added advantage) Ability to communicate the requirements and deliverables effectively to both technical teams as well as non-technical domain specialists Strong team player; ability to provide both a strong individual contribution but also work as a team and contribute to wider goals is a must in this dynamic environment Strong verbal and written communication skills to establish proper communications within the team and clients What's on Offer? Great work environment Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Work within a company with a solid track record of success

Microsoft Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers Microsoft's cloud services and our team is focused on delivering high quality infrastructure to support cloud operations. As Microsoft’s Cloud business continues to mature, the acquisition and development of our owned, designed and constructed Data Center facilities will scale to meet the demands of our customers. Cloud Operations and Innovation (CO+I) will be developing and executing strategies to deliver owned and developed sites alongside our leasing team, to scale our business into the future. The Infrastructure Planning & Acquisition (IPA) team is responsible for the acquisition and planning of Data Center Infrastructure needed to build out Microsoft’s cloud infrastructure. As part of IPA, the Land Acquisition Team is responsible for the delivery and pre-positioning of Data Center real estate needed to build out Microsoft’s cloud infrastructure. As a Real Estate Analyst, you'll dive into the real estate market, providing crucial insights and analysis to expedite our land acquisition process. Reporting to the APAC Regional Director, you will be responsible for the research and analysis of real estate market information, supporting the team to expedite the land acquisition process in the APAC regions. The position will focus on providing information to the Land Acquisition Managers to enable the team to accelerate the process and mitigate risk. You’ll engage external consultants and brokers and works with internal teams to provide information on parcels and participate with internal teams on driving the acquisition process forward. In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day. Our Team culture is one of inclusion and excellence, where every voice is heard, and every idea matters. Let's accelerate together towards a brighter future in the cloud computing landscape. Responsibilities Research and analysis of real estate market information such as market reports, industry publications, and government data across APAC regions. Expedite the evaluation, selection, and recommendation of acquisitions for approval. Streamline the management of the acquisition process for land including tasks which can range from site selection to municipal collaboration for pre-construction work. Drive tracking and reporting of APAC land acquisition transactions and strategic initiatives. Foster seamless collaboration with Microsoft CO+I stakeholders, including Finance, Legal, EPCM, etc., to expedite processes as necessary. Efficiently handle multiple assignments across various APAC regions to ensure rapid progress. Periodic travel to assigned geographies may be required to meet accelerated delivery goals. Qualifications Required Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Real Estate, Business, Finance, Engineering, or relevant experience. Minimum of 5+ years site selection, real estate, or analytical experience Preferred Qualifications Demonstrate strong analytical reasoning skills, combined with a deep understanding of business fundamentals and extensive knowledge of real estate terminology to expedite decision-making processes. Utilize expertise in the real estate transaction process to accelerate delivery timelines. Proactively cultivate and manage stakeholder relationships to facilitate swift progress. Exhibit sensitivity to diversity and inclusion considerations to ensure an inclusive and efficient work environment. Track record of successfully coordinating high-quality projects within fast-paced environments, where speed, flexibility, agility, and heavy workloads are the standard. Embrace a growth mindset and exhibit a proactive, self-starting attitude to drive continuous improvement and accelerate project delivery. Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, enabling effective interaction with real estate brokers and team members to expedite workflows and achieve accelerated outcomes. Ability to conduct the research, analyse the data and present findings effectively to others with confidence & conviction. #COICareers Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

job title: Data Scientist, Risk Data Mining - Singapore
description: Responsibilities TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us. The Business Risk Integrated Control (BRIC) team is missioned: - To protect TikTok users, including and beyond content consumers, creators, advertisers; - By securing platform health and community experience authenticity; - Through building infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to collaborate with many cross-functional teams and stakeholders. The BRIC team works to minimise the damage of inauthentic behaviours on TikTok, covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API and growth health, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc. In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences. Responsibilities - Build rules, algorithms and machine learning models, to respond to and mitigate business risks in ByteDance products/platforms. Such risks include and are not limited to abusive accounts, fake engagements, spammy redirection, scraping, fraud, etc. - Analyze business and security data, uncover evolving attack motion, identify weaknesses and opportunities in risk defense solutions, explore new space from the discoveries. - Define risk control measurements. Quantify, generalize and monitor risk related business and operational metrics. Align risk teams and their stakeholders on risk control numeric goals, promote impact-oriented, data-driven data science practices for risks. Qualifications - Bachelor or degrees above in computer science, statistics, math, internet security or other relevant STEM majors (e.g. finance if applying for financial fraud roles). - Solid data science skills. Proficiency in statistical analytical tools, such as SQL, R and Python. Preferred Qualification Minimum 3 years relevant work experience from a large-scale internet business - Familiarity with machine learning or social/content online platform analytics. Bonus given to proficiency in modern machine learning applications. - Ability to think critically, objectively, rationally. Reason and communicate in result-oriented, data-driven manner. High autonomy. - Minimum 3 - 5 years relevant work experience from a large-scale internet business TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Job Description We are looking for dynamic, passionate Applied Behaviour Analysis Therapist (ABA Therapist) to work with students who have learning difficulties, behavioural and/or special needs. Prior work experience of at least 2 years is preferred. If you are passionate about our mission to help all children break through any challenges they may face to achieve success, please join us. Job Duties & Requirements: Full time position Develop and implement therapy protocols Ensure holistic student welfare Maintain case notes and reports progress Maintaining close relationship and communication with all stakeholders of the classroom/school Provide 1:1 sessions Provide small group sessions Manage student behaviours in classroom Meet with teachers to support the student's needs in their classrooms Carry out special duties (e.g., outdoor recreation area monitor, extra-curricular activities, holiday camps, school fairs, open houses) Mentor/support Teachers in the behavioural management realm Modify lessons according to each child’s ability level Be knowledgeable on professional techniques and best practices in special education Adhere to centre's SOPs Complete respective administrative duties (e.g., maintaining the communication booklet, attendance-record keeping, etc.) Maintain, adhere to and be up to date with all relevant processes and systems Qualification/Experience requirements: Must have at least a professional diploma/certificate (but Bachelor's degree is preferred) in education, special education, counselling, psychology, or related field Minimum 2 year work experience

What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine? Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond. The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The opportunity: your next adventure awaits _________ Our global transfer pricing practice is recognized as a market leader in advising on relevant aspects of intercompany transactions. We offer depth of experience through a worldwide network of dedicated transfer pricing economists and tax professionals. Join our transfer pricing professionals to help clients build, manage, document, review and defend transfer pricing policies and processes — aligning them with their business strategy. In an ever-changing tax environment, you will develop your business acumen working with organizations to build proactive, pragmatic and integrated strategies that address the tax risks of today’s businesses and help companies achieve their highest potential. Your key responsibilities Develop sound understanding of the OECD/Singapore transfer pricing guidelines to prepare transfer pricing policy, planning reports and documentation to substantiate transfer pricing positions taken Undertake/oversee economic and benchmarking analyses to support the arm’s length nature of intercompany transactions Apply good interpersonal skills to liaise with both internal EY and external client teams Involvement with tax planning projects and tax controversy engagements What we look for You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world. You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world. You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. Qualifications: Pursuing university degree related to Accountancy, Business, Economics or equivalent Problem solving and numerical skills Ability to work with complex and detailed information Experience and/or demonstrated ability in time management and adaptability to change under pressure to build effective relationships at all levels Strong written and verbal communication skills and relationship building What’s in it for you Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs. Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally. Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development. Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society – building a better working world, together. Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: Detailed Resume, indicating internship availability period Copy of Latest / Highest Academic Certification and Transcripts __________ Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. To learn more about careers in EY, please visit Careers at EY or connect with us on social media (Facebook or Instagram) to hear from our people about their EY careers.

Headquartered in Singapore, Actxa Pte Ltd is a deep tech company founded in 2015 that leverages artificial intelligence to create next generation preventive healthcare solutions. We are an affiliated company by common shareholders with Activate Interactive Pte Ltd which company logo appears on the top of this page. Actxa creates evidence-based, personalizes health insights in the domains of physical activities, sleep quality, body composition, stress and recovery, heart health and blood glucose evaluation and monitoring. To improve population health, Actxa establishes worldwide partnerships and research collaborations to develop critical preventive health models to help people avert chronic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension. We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation. We have opportunities for you to grow your career path and are looking for talented professionals to join our team. We are seeking a passionate and visionary Lead Data Scientist to lead our data science efforts in shaping the future of healthcare in preventive health using Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and data analysis . Your work will directly contribute to improving the health and well-being of the population, reducing healthcare costs, and championing a proactive approach to healthcare. In this managerial-level role, you will drive the company's technology solutions and research initiatives. You are responsible for leading and managing a team of Data Scientists and Researchers in delivering science and data-driven innovations in preventive health and population wellness. This role requires you to have prior experience in end-to-end solutions deliveries from research to implementation involving Artificial Intelligence, data analysis, Machine Learning (ML), data analysis and statistical modeling. More information about us; https://www.actxa.com Actxa is hiring for Lead Data Scientist Internal Code: AX24002 Data Analysis and Modeling: Utilize advanced statistical techniques, artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to analyze complex datasets Develop predictive and prescriptive models to achieve business and commercial goals Explore and identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in data Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of data scientists and researchers Provide guidance and direction for project planning, execution, and prioritization Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture Research Strategy: Define research objectives, strategies, and roadmaps in alignment with organizational goals Develop and adhere to clinical research protocols for studies involving human subjects Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and research methodologies Identify emerging technologies and tools that can enhance research capabilities Establish research partnership and collaboration with local and overseas institutions Data Collection and Preparation: Oversee data acquisition, cleaning, and preprocessing Ensure data quality and integrity to maintain the accuracy of analyses Collaborate with data engineering teams to streamline data pipelines Experimentation and Hypothesis Testing: Design experiments and conduct hypothesis testing to validate research findings Evaluate the effectiveness of various models and methodologies Implement A/B testing and other statistical methods to drive decisions Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with consultants, advisors and internal teams, such as software & hardware solution, sales, marketing, and operations, to address business challenges and commercialisation opportunities Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making in clinical research projects Ethical Data Practices: Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and ethical data handling practices Maintain the security and confidentiality of sensitive data in clinical research studies Project Management: Manage multiple research projects simultaneously, including resource allocation and timelines Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies Continuous Improvement: Drive process improvements and best practices in data science and research Evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance research capabilities in clinical research studies Requirements Ph.D in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Statistic, Mathematics, Biomedical Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, or related discipline Several years of experience in artificial intelligence, data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning with strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, SQL and C/C++ Excellent communication and leadership skills Ability to think critically and solve complex problems Deep interest or knowledge in wearable technologies, preventive health, wellness, fitness, mental health, chronic disease prevention & management, population health, etc Experience with clinical trial design, execution, and analysis Previous leadership or supervisory experience, especially in leading teams of data scientists and researchers Proven track record of successful project management and delivery of data-driven insights and solutions Benefits What do we offer? Fun working environment Employee Wellness Program Actxa Pte Ltd is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Actxa Pte Ltd does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Actxa Pte Ltd. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Actxa Pte Ltd's recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes. Job Description Work with stakeholders including customers, partners and colleagues to solicit requirements, design, develop, document, manage and maintain data analytic solutions for customers or internal users; and Support data analytics solutions pre-sales initiatives, proposal development and provide post-sales support. job title: Intern - Strategy and Transactions, Lead Advisory (Off Cycle Aug - Dec 2024)
description: What if your curiosity could help build the world we all imagine? Here at EY, you’ll have the chance to build a truly exceptional experience. We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond. The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- The opportunity: your next adventure awaits Strategy and Transaction (SaT) works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimizing, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within SaT include Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) – that will bring together Transaction Diligence (TD), Valuation, Modeling and Economics (VME), and Lead Advisory (LA). Uniquely, SaT brings together a world-class strategy practice in EY-Parthenon, an unmatched Transactions and Corporate Finance (TCF) capability and the deep Tax expertise delivered via International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS). Given the longstanding and deep relationships of these competencies with our clients, our sub-service lines will allow our practice to drive further growth to an already successful practice and continue to be key drivers of innovation within our business. TD advises corporate, private equity and government clients on buy-side and sell-side financial due diligence. We work closely with SaT sub-service lines and competencies and other EY service lines to deliver seamless, integrated due diligence to our clients. VME practices are the means by which we continue to bring our deep financial, economics and analytics skills to bear in order to support our clients with better decision-making involving transactions, funding capital expansion and optimizing capital efficiency (such as capital allocation to help adjust risk, cash release opportunity, capital budgeting with skill sets on measuring and valuating not just assets but also litigation or life). LA includes tactical and strategic advice for corporates, financial sponsors and family offices, as well as negotiation assistance and other transaction related topics. Mergers & Acquisitions team provides sector-focused advice on the sale process from strategic positioning to close, and we help execute acquisitions, alliances and mergers as well as advise C-suite executives and boards on evaluating strategic alternatives in the context of transactions. Infrastructure Advisory team has extensive experience working with private and public sector organizations on business case and project development strategy, economic analysis, provision of commercial and procurement advice and raising finance on complex infrastructure projects. What we look for You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world. You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world. You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust. Qualifications: Pursuing university degree related to Accounting, Business, Finance, Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics with demonstrated interest. Demonstrated passion in related work with strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills to analyze financial and non-financial information to formulate views and conclusions. This passion could be demonstrated via university projects, internships, conferences, self-study, etc. What’s in it for you Accelerate your technical capabilities and transformative leadership skills with future-focused courses and development programs. Broaden your horizons by working on highly integrated teams across the globe and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds — both professionally and culturally. Bring out the best in yourself with continuous investment in your personal well-being and career development. Develop your own personal purpose and help us create a positive ripple effect on our teams, our business, clients and society – building a better working world, together. What you can expect You may expect up to 2 interview rounds with the hiring team. Please note that for your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application: Full detailed resume - Kindly indicate inside your resume if you are applying for Winter internship 2023 OR Off Cycle internship Jan - Jun 2024 Latest university transcript Please note that applications are shortlisted on a rolling basis. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified To learn more about careers in EY, please visit Careers at EY or connect with us on social media (Facebook or Instagram) to hear from our people about their EY careers.

job title: NTU WSDeg Internship - DTS (Data Trust Services)
description: Line of Service Assurance Industry/Sector FS X-Sector Specialism Risk Management Level Intern/Trainee Job Description & Summary We at PwC believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community that comes together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your skills are developed and put to work in exciting ways, superpowered by technology. How will you value-add: We aspire to build a team of data professionals with the ability to apply their knowledge in helping our clients solve their business challenges while future proofing their business. Our practice is integrated across different PwC Lines of Services, and works collaboratively with our clients to manage engagements and lead teams of data and analytics resources in various aspects digital, data and analytics solutions. We are looking for candidates to join us in this NTU Work Degree Study Programme (WDSP) internship from 11 Dec 2023 - 9 Aug 2024 (35 weeks) or 11 Dec 2023 – 31 May 2024 (25 weeks). About The Project If the lifeblood of the digital economy is data, its heart is digital trust—the level of confidence in people, processes, and technology to build a secure digital world. Companies, regulators, and consumers need fresh mechanisms to build confidence as they address emerging challenges in business, risk management, and compliance. In this 25-35 week internship, be prepared to dive deeper into the financial, supply chain and government sectors and journey through their digital transformation and adoption of new platforms. Choose your track: There are multiple tracks within our team where you can find your niche. Candidates will be assigned to the relevant roles, listed below, based on their experience and expertise. Please refer to the list below for a detailed description of the roles. Track A: Data Engineering A data engineer is responsible for collecting, managing, and transforming raw data into information that can be consumed and interpreted downstream by end users, facilitated by data scientists and business analysts. Your ultimate goal is to enable organizations to utilize their data for performance evaluation and optimization. Here are some of the skills and experience you may need to be effective in your role: Master’s or Bachelor’s degree and above in Analytics, Information Systems Management, Computer Science or related fields Keen Interest in working with RDBMS such as DB2, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, PostGresSQL, Teradata, etc. Possess good knowledge and experience in data quality definition, data cleansing and data treatment/profiling processes using open-source or industry-standard tools like Informatica Good knowledge of the following is a plus Data warehouse and data management implementation methodology Conceptual knowledge of the data management frameworks, including operating model, data governance, data management, data security, data quality and data architecture Big data platforms like Cloudera and HortonWorks Cloud technologies including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and their respective ETL specific services (eg: AWS Glue) Cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, Redshift, Synapse Data integration or ETL tools such as Informatica PowerCentre, Oracle Data Integrator, SAP Data Services, Ab Initio, IBM DataStage or Microsoft SSIS API Management software design and build Data Quality using Trillium Software, SAS Data Quality, SAP Data Quality Management, etc. Data visualisation using tools such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, Qlik Sense Project management methodology like agile Infrastructure paradigms such as OS, network, Certification in any of database, data integration, data management, visualisation tools and cloud is an added advantage Ability to pick up new tools and able to be independent with minimal guidance from the project leads/managers Strong analytical and creative problem-solving capabilities Ability to establish personal credibility quickly and demonstrate expertise Keen learner and self-motivated to keep abreast with latest trends in data architecture like Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh to name a few. Track B: Data Management and Governance A data management professional develops and governs data-oriented systems designed to meet the needs of an organization or research team. Data Management includes accessing, validating, and storing data that is needed for research and day-to-day business operations. Key areas of work include data quality, metadata and masterdata management, creation of data catalogues to name a few. Here are some of the skills and experience you may need to be effective in your role: A degree in technology or business-related subjects is recommended (e.g. Business Analytics, Computer Science, Accounting, Business Management, etc.) Knowledge in the Financial industry through university courses or prior internships will be an added advantage Strong technical and analytical skills coupled with good presentation skills, both oral and written Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively manage internal and external stakeholders Strong problem-solving skills and an ability to prioritise and manage multiple task Ability to lead teams under pressure with demonstrated experience in project management Self-driven, curious, a fast-learner and a strong practitioner of self-development Must be able to stay up to date on the latest trends in data analytics like Data Fabric, Data Lakehouse, Data Mesh to name a few. Conceptual understanding of various data platforms, including major cloud players like AWS, Azure and GCP is a plus A passion for client service and an ability to work from both the PwC Singapore office and client sites Track C: Data Science A data scientist’s primary job, in simple terms, is to extract actionable insights of value from data. But we expect certain more skills and qualities in the data scientists who wish to join us, like Ability to work with data to get it into proper form amenable for analysis which includes data preparation/wrangling and integration experience, feature engineering Business acumen so that you are able to understand the business problem, translate the requirements into technical requirements and then ensure use cases you formulate see the light of the day Read on only if you think you can deliver on both of the aforementioned aspects. How will you value add: Using Data Science Methods and Artificial Intelligence to enhance innovation, profitability and growth of our clients in three dimensions: (1) Business Innovation: Design and implement innovative, data-driven business models, identification, conception and assessment of industry and client specific Use Cases, Utilization of data-modeling and -analysis in every aspect of Sales, Marketing, Operations and Business-model innovation (2) Big Data and Analytics: Extract new insights from various data sources leveraging sophisticated Machine Learning and AI solutions (3) Digital Transformation: Working in multidisciplinary teams to define and implement corporate transformation as well as strategy development towards a “Data-Driven Business” leveraging data science, AI, ML and digital technologies Work with business and tech to develop end-to-end analytics solutions, from problem formulation, data sourcing to developing and deploying the solution into production Provide business domain expertise/support Provide end-to-end advanced solutions to design, develop and deploy to production system Build MLOps, CI/CD practices to manage models regarding quick experiments and feedback loop and their ultimate operationalization Communicate, interpret, execute analytics results and machine learning model details with business as well as technical stakeholders About You: Master’s or Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or other relevant fields with deep theoretical knowledge in machine learning, data mining or statistical / mathematical modelling Prior experience in the design and execution of projects related to Data Analytics, Data science and digital transformation and up-to-date on methods and technologies related to Data Science, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning and Automation Practical experience in solving complex problems using scientific methods and modelling approaches using experimental, statistical, machine learning and visualization techniques Prior experience in the identification, pursuit and opportunities conversion is a plus Proven practical interest in statistical modelling, Machine Learning, Text Mining or Data Visualization for use cases including segmenting, customer value modelling, marketing optimization, campaign management, Pricing, image and voice recognition, fraud detection, Robotics and Chatbots as well as real time data capture and evaluation. Proficient in the technical skills such as SQL, Python, PySpark, ML packages and tools Knowledge in Business Intelligence tools and relevant statistic tools/languages (e.g. R, Python, SAS) as well as Data Storytelling and visualization skills (e.g. with Tableau or QlikView) Other tools/cloud platform knowledge and experience valued: Alteryx, GCP, Azure, AWS Track D: BI and Data Visualisation Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Perform work across diverse industries and projects ranging from developing organisational strategies for analytics to building sophisticated data architectures and analytical models Analyse and interpret large volumes of data from client data systems and external sources using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits Translate complex findings into simple language and communicate them to internal and external stakeholders, such as your team members and clients executives Deliver excellent client service and work from both the PwC Singapore office and at client sites About You Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Economics, Engineering, Information Systems, Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or other related disciplines that possesses an analytical and quantitative component from a reputable university Strong communication skills and an awareness of global trends Strong preference for basic competency in two or more of the following: an analytical software (e.g. R, SAS) a data visualization tool (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI) a relational or graph database management tool (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Neo4J) programming/scripting language (e.g. VBA, C++, Java, Python) distributed architectures (e.g. HDFS, Mapreduce, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Pig, Hive) A self-driven learner with the ability to quickly learn and apply new tools and techniques such as proprietary analytical software, data models and programming languages An appreciation for structured methodical research, critical thinking and problem solving skills with an understanding for the application of these skills in the business environment A natural curiosity to identify, investigate and explain trends and patterns in data An ability to analyse and break down complex concepts and technical findings into clear and simple language for communication to team members and clients A passion for Emerging Technologies related to Big Data, Machine Learning and AI Track E: Data Generalist / Analytics focussed Business Analyst (BA) A business analyst plays a key role in the lifecycle of an analytics project, by analyzing data and providing insights that can help the stakeholders make better business decisions. As a Data Generalist or a Business Analyst, you would often work closely with data analysts to collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources, and business stakeholders to elicit analytics requirements around use cases. The ability to wear multiple hats, translate business requirements into technical requirements, drive UATs and test case scenarios, guide and manage the team delivering the data analytics project will be some of the key responsibilities in your job. About You Someone who has interest in at least two of the below tracks: Data Engineering Data Management Data Science BI and Data Visualisation Knowledge in creating and maintaining documents like Business Requirements Document (BRD), Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM), Functional Specification Document (FSD) Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively Track record of providing ongoing support and guidance to stakeholders to help them understand and use data effectively, like conducting adoption trainings, hackathons etc. is a plus Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders to identify and prioritize business needs Interest in developing and implementing data collection and analysis processes Evaluating data to identify areas for improvement and making recommendations to senior management At least a Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as business management, engineering, economics, or statistics Next Step: You will receive an email from us to complete pymetrics within 3 working days of your application submission. Pymetrics is a series of engaging online games that will assess cognitive, behavioural and emotional traits. This allows us to learn more about you and gives us insights into where you will thrive the most in our business. Note: Please note we accept only one application per candidate. You may indicate your second preference in the same application. We recommend that you apply to your preferred position that closely aligns with your skills, passions and interests. You can indicate another role in the same application form. Duplicate entries will slow down your application with us. Kindly upload both your resume and degree audit or transcript in PDF format all under Resume attachment upload Kindly note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Got a question? Email to sg_graduate_recruitment@pwc.com . There have been reports of scammers impersonating PwC HR professionals contacting individuals about fraudulent job opportunities using non-PwC domain email addresses and an overseas number. Please note that genuine communications from our HR team will only come from "@pwc.com" email address. No Government Clearance Required? No Job Posting End Date

We’ll empower you with the latest technology, surround you with high-performing teams, and provide the global scale and diverse and inclusive culture you need to discover your full potential. Through our coaching and training programs, you’ll develop the skillsets you need to stay relevant today and in the future – all while building a network of colleagues, mentors, and leaders who will be on the journey with you at EY and beyond. We support clients in three main areas: Technology implementation support Vendor package and partner selection Service strategy and roadmap Program delivery (program management, release management, benefits management) Requirements definition Solution architecture and design Enterprise and Industry application implementation Configuration and development Systems development and integration Testing Security and controls Process management and improvement Operations/as-a-service service Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) Our global GRC organization enables clients to leverage technology to successfully manage opportunities and reduce risk.
