job title: 2024 Blackstone Technology and Innovations - Software Engineering Intern (Jul to Dec 2024), Singapore
description: Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram. Innovations Profile: Blackstone Technology and Innovations (BXTI) is the technology team at the core of each of Blackstone’s businesses and new growth initiatives. Serving both internal and external clients, we work to build the next generation of systems that manage risk, create efficiency and improve transparency within the firm and across our broad community of investors and portfolio companies. BXTI is nimble and entrepreneurial – our open, iterative design processes and rapid pace of development mean that everyone on the team has the opportunity to make an impact from day one. We are problem solvers who can take projects from idea to implementation. We believe in active mentoring and developing excellence. We collaborate to find the best answers for our customers and for Blackstone. We are critical to the firm maintaining its competitive edge. Your Role: The BXTI Alternative Asset Management Technology team is looking for a 6-month Engineering intern to join in 2024, who can commit to full-time employment from July to December 2024. As a full stack software engineer, you’ll develop innovative technologies that are changing the Alternative Asset Management industry. You’ll work with other engineers and business analysts across Singapore and New York to design, build, deploy, and support Blackstone Innovations' suite of applications. Our custom-built applications are mostly developed in Python or C# on the .NET platform with JavaScript/React/Node.js and hosted within AWS. We take full advantage of cloud native container-based and serverless architectures. We also build robust data pipelines connecting to Snowflake for data analysis and visualization. You’ll devise elegant solutions to Blackstone's most meaningful technical challenges and put your own best ideas to work in an entrepreneurial environment inside one of the leading companies in its industry. How you'll make an impact and the tools you'll use to do it: Build web applications, services, and functionality on a variety of platforms Develop on top of AWS in order to build cloud native, serverless first solutions Utilize Docker to create containerized microservices Automate infrastructure configuration using Terraform Use tools such as Airflow, dbt and AWS Step Functions to build data pipelines Integrate various JavaScript libraries such as React to deliver seamless user experiences Design data models and transform data with dbt Optimize and persist data in Snowflake Use TeamCity and Jenkins to automate deployments Write automated unit, integration, and deployment tests Build tooling to automate away repetitive tasks The skills and experience you'll need to make an impact: Object-oriented programming experience in C# or Python SQL experience to work with data in Snowflake Strong analytical, problem solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills, with the ability to multitask and deliver under tight deadlines; the candidate should be a self-starter that thrives on complexity and solution finding A desire to learn and adapt to new technologies A self-starting, entrepreneurial attitude A desire to keep improving Strong interpersonal and communication skills Eligibility: To be considered for the 2024 Software Engineer Program, applicants must meet the following criteria: Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student or graduate student in Computer Science and /or Engineering majors are preferred, while other majors may be considered Undergraduate, Master (non-MBA) who will be graduate in between December 2024 to June 2025 Commit to working full time for the entire duration of the internship Resume must include expected graduation month and year and GPA Resume must be in PDF format Program Commencement July to December 2024 (6-month, start and end-date can be flexible) The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion. Blackstone is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic predisposition, veteran or military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, a sex offense or stalking, or any other class or status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training. All Blackstone employees, including but not limited to recruiting personnel and hiring managers, are required to abide by this policy. If you need a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, please contact Human Resources at 212-583-5000 (US), +44 (0)20 7451 4000 (EMEA) or +852 3656 8600 (APAC). Depending on the position, you may be required to obtain certain securities licenses if you are in a client facing role and/or if you are engaged in the following: Attending client meetings where you are discussing Blackstone products and/or and client questions; Marketing Blackstone funds to new or existing clients; Supervising or training securities licensed employees; Structuring or creating Blackstone funds/products; and Advising on marketing plans prepared by a sales team or developing and/or contributing information for marketing materials. Note: The above list is not the exhaustive list of activities requiring securities licenses and there may be roles that require review on a case-by-case basis. Please speak with your Blackstone Recruiting contact with any questions. To submit your application please complete the form below. Fields marked with a red asterisk * must be completed to be considered for employment (although some can be answered "prefer not to say"). Failure to provide this information may compromise the follow-up of your application. When you have finished click Submit at the bottom of this form.

description: Job Title: Software Engineering Intern - Sustainable Finance & Innovation Location: Singapore Duration: Minimum of 3 months About Our Team We are at the forefront of sustainable finance innovation within a globally recognized corporation. Located in Singapore, our team collaborates with partners in Bangkok and London, embodying innovation, diversity, and technological expertise. Our vision is to employ technology to create a financial ecosystem that is efficient, ethical, and sustainable. The Opportunity As a Software Engineering Intern within the Sustainable Finance & Innovation Team,, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and sustainable finance. This role offers exposure to a diverse tech stack and the chance to apply your skills in a real-world setting. What You'll Do Work with a Leading-Edge Tech Stack: Gain exposure to technologies including Python or JavaScript, Terraform, AWS, and serverless architectures like DynamoDB, API Gateway, and Lambda functions. Lead a Capstone Project: Oversee a capstone project from start to finish, with guidance from senior team members, applying your technical skills to a tangible project within the realm of sustainable finance. Deep Dive into Sustainable Finance: Acquire deep insights into sustainable finance, positioning yourself at the forefront of this transformative industry. Experience Multicultural Collaboration: Be part of a vibrant, multicultural team, benefiting from the diversity of thoughts and innovations. Receive Mentorship: Enjoy mentorship from industry leaders eager to share their knowledge and contribute to your professional growth. Who We're Looking For Enrolled in a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, with a strong interest in applying technology to societal challenges. Curious about the potential of technology to drive positive change and keen to explore new solutions. Possesses strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions to complex challenges. An effective communicator, capable of working well within a diverse team environment. Adaptable and open to learning, ready to engage in a vibrant and evolving setting. Required Skills And Experience Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python or JavaScript. Familiarity with both is a plus. Web Development: Experience with React, or a strong interest in learning it. API Development: An understanding of RESTful APIs, with experience in API Gateway and Lambda functions considered a plus. Serverless and Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with AWS and an understanding of serverless architecture is considered a plus. Microservices Architecture: An understanding of microservices architecture principles, beneficial for designing and developing scalable and maintainable applications. Software Development Practices: A foundation in software development principles, including version control (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines. Experience with containerization tools like Docker is a plus. Database Technologies: Knowledge of or willingness to learn database technologies, especially DynamoDB, or experience with other NoSQL databases. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively. What's In It For You A Pathway to Your Future: This internship is a gateway to the dynamic world of sustainable finance, equipping you with essential skills and knowledge for a thriving career in technology. A Diverse and Inclusive Experience: Join a team where diversity and inclusion are celebrated, and your unique perspectives are valued. Personalized Mentorship: Receive direct mentorship from experienced professionals dedicated to your learning and professional development. How To Apply Please submit your resume, optionally including any relevant projects or experiences that highlight your skills and interests in technology's role in sustainable finance. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace and encourage applications from all technical backgrounds. Application Deadline: 30 April 2024 Dive into the transformative world of sustainable finance with us. We're eager to see the unique contributions you will bring to our team! LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth. Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership , Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions. Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity. LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives. We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject. If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

Frontend Developer What's on offer Contract Role - with a view of extension Industry : IT Consultant Location : Singapore Requirements 5-9 years of experience in frontend web development using React and related technologies Strong UI/UX design skills and experience with design tools (e.g. Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma) Experience with wireframing, stakeholder management, and demo preparation Familiarity with version control using Git Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment Good communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

About The Team Shopee Paid ads team was established in 2016 to provide an e-commerce advertising platform by relying on Shopee’s massive data. Our expertise covers data, high performance AI-based online services, distributed systems, machine learning algorithms, and ads business strategies. The team places a strong emphasis on technology and strives to achieve innovation. Job Description Develop the marketplace backend system of Shopee Ads to support ads products such as search, recommendation and display ads Design, build and manage ads systems with high performance, scalability and availability, enhancing Shopee’s infrastructure Optimise the platform services efficiency and stability to cater to the rapid growth of business Requirements Current student studying Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other relevant majors who are expected to graduate in 2025 Good data structure and algorithm knowledge and system design skills Familiar with Linux based development and commonly used tech components Strong critical thinking skills and able to formulate solutions for problems in a clear and logical manner Passionate about technical challenges, self-motivated and able to deliver project requirements timely Good communication skills and an effective team player with a strong sense of ownership
